alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 10:27PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN HARRISON COUNTY THROUGH 1045 PM EDT... At 1026 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Cynthiana, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Breckinridge, Berry, Robinson, Colemansville, Oddville, Boyd, Claysville, Antioch, Garnett and Kelat. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
